param.name: maxoffset

param.name: ilim

param.help: All peaks less than this percentage of the target peak will be removed from the purity calculation, default is 5\% (0.05)

param.name: iw_norm

param.option: Calculated from Q-Exactive for +/- 0.5 Da windows

param.name: isotopes
param.label: Handling of isotopic peaks
param.option: Keep isotopes in precursor ion purity calculation
Exclude C12/C13 isotopes in precursor ion purity calculation
Exclude a user supplied list of isotopes in purity calculation

param.name: im
param.label: Isotope matrix
param.help: tabular file composing of columns: ['isotope_id', 'mass diff', 'abundance of isotope', 'ppm tol for mz', 'abundance buffer', 'charge', 'relative atomic mass (int)', 'xflag']. The xflag indicates if the larger (mass) isotope is the most abundant or less abundant. e.g. for c12 to c13, the c13 is less abundant so we flag as 1 for Li6 to Li7, the Li7 is more abundant so we would flag as 0. Example row: For C13 isotope (single charge) the row could be [1, 1.003355, 1.07, 4, 0.1, 1, 12, 1]

param.name: camera_xcms
param.label: Use CAMERA object or XCMS object from RData?
param.help: Within the RData file there should be either an XCMS object called xset or a CAMERA object called xa (or both). The XCMS object is nested within the CAMERA object so either can be used
